page.title: 05St.Peter's Church
page.content: The{Church}consists of chancel, nave, north and south aisles of three bays, with a bell gable at the west end and a small porch. The whole of the northern portion, the south chancel aisle and all the roofs are modern. The east wall of the chancel is ancient up to the spring of the arch of the window, so is the south side of the chancel. The{south aisle}is said to have been built in 1806, but the{mediaeval {windows were re-used. }There are three in the south wall, square headed, each of two ogee-headed lights cinquefoiled, the two eastmost having trefoiled tracery lights. The{arcade}has thick circular piers, narrow moulded capitals, no bases, and pointed arches of low pitch chamfered. It is said to date from 1806.
